@stoweboyd 2/ If you have symptoms and test negative still do not visit friends. Or at least meet outdoors with an N95 mask and plenty of air movement. Do not rely on home tests for individual safety. However they are useful as a public health measure as they reduce overall transmission...

@stoweboyd all tests have some level of false negatives. Things like home tests tend to be worse in general due to the lack of control over testing conditions. So a home test helps somewhat as a positive means you are positive but you cannot rely on a negative test. General rul eof thumb:

@InsidersABC 4/... forecasting. It is acceptance of the reality and reducing reliance on them for our planning. For anyone that is interested I had a piece published in The Age about this a long time ago: https://t.co/X7bf646zco

@InsidersABC 3/... They work pretty well when we do not need them to and very poorly when we need them to. If our cars had brakes that worked perfectly in normal traffic but failed every time there was a need to brake urgently there would be an uproar. The solution here is not better....

@InsidersABC 2/... forecasts that have to be revised every few weeks are not forecasts they are guesses. That is not to say that I would do any better, the point is that economic forecasts work when everything is stable but are terrible when things are in s state of change. In other words...

I am troubled by the discussion on this weeks @InsidersABC on economic forecasts. On one hand the commentators were making the point that the forecasts in the budget were already out of date and then treating the current forecasts as if they were written in stone. In general...

4/... We did a scenario like this for a client in September looking at supply chain disruptions in 2022 called

A Period of Grace Followed by a New Wave

I am less pessimistic than I was then given high vaccination rates but it is still a possible and highly preventable scenario

3/... and complacency on public health measures and social distancing.

Act 3: Winter comes. Flu vaccination rates are lower than  normal. International travel picks up. Despite vaccination we follow the pattern currently being experienced in the Northern Hemisphere of new surges

2/... Exceptions are the pockets of Australia with lower vaccination rates. Especially remote indigenous communities

Act 2: Due to everything going ok complacency coming into next winter results in low uptake of booster vaccinations and immunity wanes from the initial vaxx....

A Pandemic scenario for Australia in several acts:

Act 1: due to high vaccination rates, people maintaining a level of social distancing and summer increasing outdoor events and ventilation rates the next few months are fairly smooth.

And yes I accept the actual failure rate ....

8/... 99.9994% accuracy (the test I developed was nowhere near that accurate. It is amazing technology). When you do a large number of tests in a population that is almost completely free of disease you are going to get false positives ....

7/... not disastrous. And we must remember the tests are very accurate. In Victoria in the last 7 days we have had about 340,000 people tested that were not infected (https://t.co/QrpEeuRjwc…)
We have had two reported false positive cases. That is a failure rate of 0.0006% or...

5/... positive causes an investigation and hardship for the individual farm and animals but is much less consequential. This is analogous to the current COVID testing situation when we have very low case numbers. It is less important in a country with thousands of cases....

4/ .... If I am testing for a disease like Foot and Mouth disease in livestock in Australia  a false negative is far worse than a false positive. A false negative means we miss the disease and by the time we figure out the problem it might have spread much more widely. A false ..

3/... If you have cancer and a test tells you that you don't that can be really bad. If the test tells you that you do have cancer when you don't that can be bad too but it might be less bad than missing the diagnosis. 
In general a test for an individual needs the be better...

2/.... always a balance between false positives and false negatives and the balance is also about the risk and context. A false positive is telling you that you have a disease or problem when you don't and a false negative is telling you you don't have a disease when you do....
